NAME: Hinsby, Cadillo-Quiroz
OFICIAL_NAME: Microbial composition and functional potential in Tropical Peatlands: comparing Costa Rican and Peruvian soil carbon cycling
TOPICS: Specifically, this study seeks to: a) characterize the bacterial, archaeal and fungal community compositions of a total of 50 distinct peatlands and forest soils across Central America, South America and South East Asia via amplicon sequencing with the Illumina MiSeq platform; b) measure the potential function of organic matter cycling by these communities and linking to SOC formation versus GHG production; c) identifying the key environmental parameters that define community composition and function; and finally d) to model how predicted effects of climate change on key environmental parameters, for example rainfall patterns and temperature, will affect SOC formation versus GHG production.
